name: v0.6.3
body: Fixes issues around bulk allocation and the registry

name: Cleanup links and iptables rules appropriately
body: This release garbage collects links and iptables rules.

name: v0.6.0
body:
* Use the AWS API to retrieve instance network limits
* Add IP allocation batching

name: v0.5.3
body: - Support more instance families and types from AWS

name: v0.5.2
body: - Allow building multi-arch images through the Makefile

name: v0.5.1
body:
- Migrate to Go modules on Go 1.13 (#72)
- Allow specifying the maximum number of pods, not just the ENI limit (#69)
- Inherit MTU from main interface (#66)
- Updates ENI Limits (#71)

name: v0.5.0
body:
- New AWS instance support
- Support node_port instances
- Harden NAT rules

Thanks to all of our contributors!

name: v0.3.1
body: - Fix an issue with nil pointers when VPC peering connections are parsed.

name: v0.3.0
body:
Fixes #23, #14, #22, #21 

- Add delayed GC support by running the -tool with a new registry-gc option and using deferred deallocation in the IPAM plugin.
- Workaround bugs on some C5 and M5 class hardware with the AWS metadataservice
- Support routing to VPC peers through the VPC IPvlan interface.

name: v0.2.1
body: Fix #15 - use the primary IP on newly made ENI adapters

name: v0.2.0
body:
* Fixes issues relating to Docker free-IP detection
* No longer loses the source IP address when using kube-proxy based service IPs.

name: v0.1.8
body:
This release includes a new `tool` flag to filter subnets when creating interfaces. This is useful to pre-warm a secondary interface when launching a new kubelet. 

Syntax:

```cni-ipvlan-vpc-k8s-tool new-interface --subnet_filter=tagKey=tagValue sg-12345678...```

name: v0.1.7
body: Initial public release. This version is based on Lyft's internal version.
